categories.name: Argument parsing
categories.description: Crates that focus on taking the arguments to your CLI and turning them into data you can use.

categories.name: Command generation
categories.description: Crates that generate command output for you, for example help pages.

categories.name: Formatting
categories.description: Helpers to properly format strings in the terminal, to add color, or other things.

categories.name: Structured output
categories.description: Helpers for stuff like tables, boxes, anything else fancy you want to display in the terminal.

categories.name: Errors, logging, diagnostics
categories.description: The things nobody wants to do (at least in other languages)

categories.name: Interactivity
categories.description: Anything user-facing that does things beside write text to stdout. Interactive prompts, progress bars, and so on.

categories.name: Other
categories.description: Libraries that don't fit in other categories but are nonetheless extremely useful for CLIs.

crates.name: lexopt
crates.description: Very minimal argument parser, pedantic about correctness.

crates.name: pico-args
crates.description: Also very minimal, less pedantic and more ergonomic.

crates.name: console
crates.description: Console abstraction library. Includes a lot of helpful utilities around formatting and aligning text.

crates.name: thiserror
crates.description: Makes casting other errors into your own type(s) much easier. Recommended for libraries.

crates.name: miette
crates.description: Provides a way to report diagnostics and print very well detailed errors.

crates.name: tracing
crates.description: The standard logging library these days. Also supports generating traces, spans, and so on.

crates.name: insta
crates.description: Snapshot testing library with good support for snapshotting CLI output.
